translated: Abhidharma Treatise on the Aggregates, Bases, and Elements, Scroll 1
Composed by Venerable Vasumitra
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
The three grounds each have ten kinds, five afflictions and five views,
five contacts, five faculties and dharmas, six and six corresponding to the body.

There are ten universal mental factors, ten fundamental afflictions, ten secondary afflictions, five afflictions, five views, five contacts, five faculties, five dharmas, six consciousnesses, six contacts, six feelings, six perceptions, six thoughts, and six cravings.
What are the ten universal mental factors?
First, feeling;
Second, conception;
Third, volition;
Fourth, contact;
Fifth, attention;
Sixth, desire;
Seventh, resolve;
Eighth, mindfulness;
Ninth, concentration;
Tenth, wisdom.
What are the ten fundamental afflictions?
First, lack of faith;
Second, laziness;
Third, forgetfulness;
Fourth, mental distraction;
Fifth, ignorance;
Sixth, incorrect knowledge;
Seventh, improper mental activity;
Eighth, wrong resolve;
Ninth, agitation;
Tenth, negligence.
What are the ten secondary afflictions?
First, anger;
Second, resentment;
Third, concealment;
Fourth, vexation;
Fifth, jealousy;
Sixth, stinginess;
Seventh, deceit;
Eighth, flattery;
Ninth, pride;
Tenth, harmfulness.
What are the five afflictions?
First, desire-realm greed;
Second, form-realm greed;
Third, formless-realm greed;
Fourth, anger;
Fifth, doubt.
What are the five views?
First, the view of a real self;
Second, the view of holding to an extreme;
Third, wrong view;
Fourth, the view of holding a view as paramount;
Fifth, the view of holding ethical precepts and vows as paramount.
What are the five contacts?
First, contact with resistance;
Second, contact with verbal expression;
Third, contact with clarity;
Fourth, contact with ignorance;
Fifth, contact that is neither clear nor ignorant.
What are the five faculties?
First, the faculty of pleasure;
Second, the faculty of pain;
Third, the faculty of joy;
Fourth, the faculty of distress;
Fifth, the faculty of equanimity.
What are the five dharmas?
First, investigation;
Second, analysis;
Third, consciousness;
Fourth, lack of conscience;
Fifth, lack of shame.
What are the six groups of consciousness?
First, eye consciousness;
Second, ear consciousness;
Third, nose consciousness;
Fourth, tongue consciousness;
Fifth, body consciousness;
Sixth, mind consciousness.
What are the six groups of contact?
First, eye contact;
Second, ear contact;
Third, nose contact;
Fourth, tongue contact;
Fifth, body contact;
Sixth, mind contact.
What are the six groups of feeling?
First, feeling born from eye contact;
Second, feeling born from ear contact;ğŸ”½Third, feeling born from nose contact;
Fourth, feeling born from tongue contact;
Fifth, feeling born from body contact;
Sixth, feeling born from mind contact.
What are the six groups of perceptions?
First, perception born from eye contact;
Second, perception born from ear contact;ğŸ”½Third, perception born from nose contact;
Fourth, perception born from tongue contact;
Fifth, perception born from body contact;
Sixth, perception born from mind contact.
What are the six groups of intentions?
First, intention born from eye contact;
Second, intention born from ear contact;ğŸ”½Third, intention born from nose contact;
Fourth, intention born from tongue contact;
Fifth, intention born from body contact;
Sixth, intention born from mind contact.
What are the six groups of craving?
First, craving born from eye contact;
Second, love born from ear contact;ğŸ”½Third, love born from nose contact;
Fourth, love born from tongue contact;
Fifth, love born from body contact;
Sixth, love born from mind contact.
What is feeling?
It refers to feeling, equal feeling, each equal feeling, already feeling, and future feeling, which are included in feeling. This is called feeling.
What is perception?
It refers to perception, equal perception, present perception, already perceived, and future perception. This is called perception.
What is volition?
It refers to volition, equal volition, present volition, already willed, and future willing, which are included in volition and create mental activities. This is called volition.
What is contact?
It refers to contact, equal contact, present contact, already contacted, and future contact. This is called contact.
What is attention?
It refers to the mind leading, following, and equally following, present attention, already attended, and future attention, which is the mind's alertness. This is called attention.
What is desire?

Namely, the nature of desire, the nature of present desire, the nature of joy and pleasure, the nature of heading towards, the nature of longing for, the nature of seeking with delight, the nature of wanting to do something, this is called desire.
What is resolve?
It is the nature of the mind's resolve, the resolve that has been made and the resolve that will be made, this is called resolve.
What is mindfulness?

It is mindfulness, following mindfulness, distinguishing mindfulness, recollecting mindfulness, the nature of recollecting mindfulness, the nature of non-forgetfulness, the nature of not losing the Dharma of non-forgetfulness, the nature of not losing the Dharma of non-forgetfulness, the mind's clear recollection, this is called mindfulness.
What is concentration?

It is the mind's abiding, abiding equally, presently abiding, closely abiding, non-disorder, non-scattering, embracing, tranquility, equalizing the mind, the nature of one-pointedness of mind, this is called concentration.
What is wisdom?

It is discernment of dharmas, utmost discernment, thorough discernment, the characteristics of dharmas, proximate characteristics, equal characteristics, wisdom penetrating understanding, thorough investigation and discernment, the illumination and wisdom of awakening, vipaÅ›yanÄ, this is called wisdom.
What is lack of faith?

It is the nature of lack of faith, the nature of non-manifest faith, the nature of non-approval, the nature of non-acceptance, the nature of not having entrusted faith, the nature of not entrusting, the nature of not presently entrusting, causing the mind to be impure, this is called lack of faith.
What is laziness?

It is the nature of non-diligence, the nature of inferior diligence, the nature of dull diligence, the nature of obstructing diligence, the nature of ceasing diligence, the mind not being courageous, not having been courageous, not being about to be courageous, this is called laziness.
What is forgetfulness?

It is the nature of empty mindfulness, the nature of vain mindfulness, the nature of forgetful mindfulness, the nature of lost mindfulness, the nature of the mind not clearly remembering, this is called forgetfulness.
What is distraction?

It refers to the nature of a scattered mind, the nature of a confused mind, the nature of a mind with different thoughts, the nature of a mind confused and disordered, the nature of a mind not focused on one object, the nature of not abiding in one object, this is called mental confusion.
What is ignorance?
It refers to the non-knowledge of the three realms.
What is incorrect knowledge?
It refers to the wisdom that is not in accordance with principle.
What is incorrect mental application?
It refers to defiled mental application.
What is wrong resolve?
It refers to the resolve of the mind associated with defiled mental application, the mind's approval, this is called wrong resolve.
What is restlessness?
It refers to the nature of a mind that is not tranquil, not extremely tranquil, not tranquil, agitated and equally agitated, the nature of an agitated mind, this is called restlessness.
What is negligence?

It refers to not firmly engaging in abandoning unwholesome dharmas and accumulating wholesome dharmas, not constantly engaging, not being intimate or close, not cultivating or practicing, this is called negligence.
What is anger?
Namely, anger, pervasive anger, extreme anger, past anger, and future anger, this is called anger.
What is resentment?
It means the mind is resentful, equally resentful, and the nature of the mind is resentful, this is called resentment.
What is concealment?
It means concealing one's faults.
What is vexation?
It means the mind is vexed, firmly grasping at faults, and the nature of the mind is twisted, this is called vexation.
What is jealousy?
It means the mind cannot tolerate the prosperity and benefits of others.
What is stinginess?
It means being attached to wealth and the Dharma and not letting go.
What is deceit?
It means deceiving others.
What is flattery?
It means the mind is crooked.
What is pride?
It means as if someone thinks like this:
I possess wonderful appearance, wealth, status, skills, the merit of pure livelihood, and my appearance is upright and pleasing to the eyes of the crowd.
For this reason, one gives rise to arrogance, extreme arrogance, intoxication, and extreme intoxication, and the nature of the mind being haughty, this is called pride.
What is harmfulness?
It is the act of inflicting harm and injury upon sentient beings, this is called harmfulness.
What is craving for sensual pleasures?

It is the craving for sensual pleasures, the craving for equal or superior sensual pleasures, the grasping, grasping at, and attachment to sensual pleasures, this is called craving for sensual pleasures.
What is craving for form?
It is the craving for form, the craving for equal or superior form, the grasping, grasping at, and attachment to form, this is called craving for form.
What is craving for the formless?
It is the craving for the formless, the craving for equal or superior formless states, the grasping, grasping at, and attachment to the formless, this is called craving for the formless.
What is hatred?

It means wishing to harm sentient beings, harboring resentment within, extreme anger, pervasive anger, etc., anger, extreme anger, mental rage, present anger, past anger, and future anger. This is called anger.
What is doubt?
It means doubt about the truths.
What is the view of existence?

It means observing and grasping at the five appropriated aggregates as either the self or what belongs to the self, and by this giving rise to patience, pleasure, wisdom, and views. This is called the view of existence.
What is the view of extremes?

It means observing and grasping at the five appropriated aggregates as either annihilation or permanence, and by this giving rise to patience, pleasure, wisdom, and views. This is called the view of extremes.
What is wrong view?
It means denying causes, denying effects, denying function, or destroying reality, and by this giving rise to patience, pleasure, wisdom, and views. This is called wrong view.
What is the grasping of views?

It means to contemplate and grasp the five aggregates of clinging as the most, the best, the supreme, and to give rise to acceptance, delight, wisdom, and views based on this, which is called the view of holding to an extreme.
What is the view of holding to mere rules and rituals?

It means to contemplate and grasp the five aggregates of clinging as purity, liberation, and escape, and to give rise to acceptance, delight, wisdom, and views based on this, which is called the view of holding to mere rules and rituals.
What is contact that is resistant?
It means contact associated with the five consciousnesses.
What is contact that is verbal?
It means contact associated with mental consciousness.
What is contact that is clear?
It means uncontaminated contact.
What is contact that is ignorance?
It means defiled contact.
What is contact that is neither clear nor ignorance?
It means contaminated contact that is not defiled.
What is the faculty of pleasure?

It means bodily and mental pleasure that accords with the experience of pleasure, and the feeling of equanimity that is included in the experience of pleasure, which is called the faculty of pleasure.
What is the faculty of pain?
That is to say, contact that accords with painful feeling, the bodily pain and unequal feeling that arises due to contact, and is included in feeling, is called the faculty of pain.
What is the faculty of joy?
That is to say, contact that accords with joyful feeling, the mental joy and equal feeling that arises due to contact, and is included in feeling, is called the faculty of joy.
What is the faculty of sorrow?
That is to say, contact that accords with sorrowful feeling, the mental sorrow and unequal feeling that arises due to contact, and is included in feeling, is called the faculty of sorrow.
What is the faculty of equanimity?

That is to say, contact that accords with neither painful nor joyful feeling, the bodily and mental equanimity and neither equal nor unequal feeling that arises due to contact, and is included in feeling, is called the faculty of equanimity.
What is applied thought?

That is to say, the mind's investigation, thorough investigation, manifestation, extreme manifestation, manifest manifestation, seeking, thorough seeking, calculation, thorough calculation, construction, thorough construction, discrimination, equal discrimination, the nature of equal discrimination, this is called applied thought.
What is sustained thought?

It means that the mind circulates, fully circulates, and follows full circulation; it observes, fully observes, and follows full observation; it follows transformation, follows flow, and follows the nature of dependence on others. This is called investigation.
What is consciousness?
It refers to the six groups of consciousness, namely eye consciousness up to mind consciousness.
What is shamelessness?

It means having no shame, nothing to be ashamed of, no distinction in shame, having no embarrassment, nothing to be embarrassed about, no distinction in embarrassment, having no respect, nothing to be respected, no distinction in respect, having no self-mastery, nothing to be self-mastered, no distinction in self-mastery, having nothing to fear or avoid, and turning with self-mastery. This is called shamelessness.
What is lack of conscience?

It means having no conscience, nothing to be conscientious about, no distinction in conscience, having no sense of shame, nothing to be ashamed of, no distinction in shame, the nature of not fearing wrongdoing, the nature of not fearing offenses, not seeing fear in offenses. This is called lack of conscience.
What is eye consciousness?
It refers to eye consciousness that arises with the eye and form as conditions.
Here, the eye is the dominant factor, and form is the object. The discrimination and specific discrimination of what is cognized by the eye in relation to form is called eye consciousness.
What is ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness?
It is the mind consciousness that arises in dependence on the mind and dharmas as conditions.
Here, the mind is the dominant factor, and dharmas are the object. The discrimination and specific discrimination of what is cognized by the mind in relation to dharmas is called mind consciousness.
What is eye contact?
It is the contact that arises from the coming together of the eye, form, and the eye consciousness.
Here, the eye is the dominant factor, and form is the object. The contact, equal contact, present contact, and future contact in relation to the eye consciousness of form is called eye contact.
What is ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact?
It is the contact that arises from the coming together of the mind, dharmas, and the mind consciousness.

The intention is the dominant factor, and the dharmas are the objective supports. The various contacts, contacts that are present, and contacts that will be present in the future with regard to the dharmas cognized by the mind are called mental contact.
What is feeling born of eye contact?
The eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling.

Here, the eye is the dominant factor, and form is the objective support. Eye contact is the cause, eye contact is the origination, eye contact is the type, eye contact is the condition, and eye contact gives rise to attention. With regard to the forms cognized by the eye, the various feelings, feelings that are present, and feelings that will be present, which are included in feeling, are called feeling born of eye contact.
What is feeling born of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact?
The mind and dharmas as conditions give rise to mind consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling.

The meaning here is that intention is the dominant condition, dharmas are the objective condition, mental contact is the cause, mental contact is the origin, mental contact is the type, mental contact is the condition, and mental contact gives rise to attention. Associated with attention, one experiences, equally experiences, individually experiences, has experienced, will experience, and is included in experience regarding dharmas cognized by the mind. This is called feeling born from contact with the mind.
What is conceptualization born from contact with the eye?
It is that which arises based on the eye and form giving rise to eye consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact, and contact serves as the condition for conceptualization.

Here, the eye is the dominant condition, form is the objective condition, eye contact is the cause, eye contact is the origin, eye contact is the type, eye contact is the condition, and eye contact gives rise to attention. Associated with attention, one conceives, equally conceives, individually conceives, conceives in the present, has conceived, will conceive, and is included in conception regarding forms cognized by the eye. This is called conceptualization born from contact with the eye.
What is conceptualization born from contact with the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind?

That is to say, the mental faculty and dharmas as conditions give rise to mental consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact serves as the condition for conceptualization.

Herein, the mental faculty is the dominant condition, dharmas are the objective condition, mental contact is the cause, mental contact is the origination, mental contact is the type, mental contact is the condition, and mental contact gives rise to the associated attention. Regarding the dharmas cognized by the mental faculty, all conceptualization, equal conceptualization, individual equal conceptualization, present equal conceptualization, past conceptualization, and future conceptualization, this is called conceptualization produced by mental contact.
What is volition produced by eye contact?
That is to say, the eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact serves as the condition for volition.

Here, the eye is the dominant condition, form is the objective condition, eye contact is the cause, eye contact is the origination, eye contact is the type, eye contact is the source, eye contact is the condition, and the volition associated with the attention that arises from eye contact. Regarding the forms cognized by the eye, the various thoughts, the equal thoughts, the individual equal thoughts, the present equal thoughts, the thoughts that have already occurred, and the thoughts that will occur, which are included in volition and are mental activities that are created by the mind and thought, this is called the volition that arises from eye contact.
What is the volition that arises from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact?
It is the volition that arises from the contact that occurs when the mind, mental factors, and consciousness are combined.

Here, the mind is the dominant condition, mental factors are the objective condition, mind contact is the cause, mind contact is the origination, mind contact is the type, mind contact is the source, mind contact is the condition, and the volition associated with the attention that arises from mind contact. Regarding the mental factors cognized by the mind, the various thoughts, the equal thoughts, the individual equal thoughts, the present equal thoughts, the thoughts that have already occurred, and the thoughts that will occur, which are included in volition and are mental activities that are created by the mind and thought, this is called the volition that arises from mind contact.
What is the craving born from eye contact?

Namely, the eye and form as conditions give rise to eye consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling. Feeling as a condition gives rise to craving.

Here, the eye is the dominant condition, and form is the object. The craving, attachment to, guarding, and delighting in the various forms cognized by the eye, is called the craving born from eye contact.
What is the craving born from ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact?

Namely, the mind and mental objects as conditions give rise to mind consciousness. Due to the combination of the three, there is contact. Contact as a condition gives rise to feeling. Feeling as a condition gives rise to craving.

Here, the mind is the dominant condition, and mental objects are the object. The craving, attachment to, guarding, and delighting in the various mental objects cognized by the mind, is called the craving born from mind contact.
There are eighteen doors, the first three are of different kinds,
Namely, feeling, consciousness, and the body, along with lack of shame and lack of conscience;
The remaining gates are eighty-five, namely the sequence of feelings, etc.,
Association and non-association, one line each, with the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

analyzed: äº”å—æ ¹ï¼Œè¬‚æ¨‚æ ¹ã€è‹¦æ ¹ã€å–œæ ¹ã€æ†‚æ ¹ã€æ¨æ ¹ã€‚
translated: The five faculties of feeling, namely the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of joy, the faculty of depression, and the faculty of equanimity.
Among the earth-like dharmas, how many feelings are associated with the five faculties of feeling, and how many are not associated?
Up to the craving born of contact with the mind, how many are associated with the five faculties of feeling, and how many are not associated?
Among the earth-like dharmas, feeling is not associated with the five faculties of feeling, and is all not associated.
Among the earth-like dharmas, conception is associated with all the five faculties of feeling, and there is none that is not associated.
Just as with conception, so it is with volition, contact, attention, desire, resolve, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.
Among the five faculties of feeling, disbelief is associated with five faculties and not associated with five faculties.
Just as with disbelief, so it is with the other great defilement-dharmas.
Anger, resentment, vexation, jealousy, and harm are associated with two faculties, namely, sorrow and indifference, and are not associated with the other five faculties.
Concealment, deceit, and flattery are associated with three faculties, excluding joy and suffering, and are not associated with the other five faculties.
Arrogance is associated with four faculties, excluding suffering, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
Stinginess is associated with two faculties, namely, joy and indifference, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
Desire for sensual pleasure and desire for form are associated with three faculties, excluding suffering and sorrow, and are not associated with the other five faculties.
Desire for the formless is associated with one faculty, namely, indifference, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
Hatred is associated with three faculties, excluding joy and pleasure, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
Doubt is associated with four faculties, excluding suffering, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
Among the five views, wrong view is associated with four faculties, excluding suffering, and is not associated with the other five faculties.
The remaining four views are associated with three faculties, excluding suffering and sorrow, and are not associated with the other five faculties.
Contact with resistance is associated with three faculties, excluding joy and sorrow, and is not associated with four faculties, excluding suffering.
Contact with verbal expression is associated with four faculties, excluding suffering, and is not associated with three faculties, excluding joy, sorrow.
Contact with clarity is associated with three faculties, excluding suffering and sorrow, and is not associated with five faculties.
Contact with ignorance and contact with neither clarity nor ignorance are associated with five faculties and are not associated with five faculties.
The faculty of pleasure is not associated with anything and is not associated with anything.

analyzed: å¦‚æ¨‚æ ¹ï¼Œè‹¦æ ¹ã€å–œæ ¹ã€æ†‚æ ¹ã€æ¨æ ¹äº¦çˆ¾ã€‚
translated: As with the faculty of pleasure, the same applies to the faculties of suffering, joy, sorrow, and equanimity.
Reflection and investigation are associated with five faculties and are not associated with three faculties, excluding suffering and sorrow.
Consciousness is associated with five faculties and is not associated with anything.
Shamelessness and disregard are associated with five faculties and are not associated with five faculties.
Eye-consciousness is associated with three faculties, excluding joy and sorrow, and is not associated with five faculties.
The same applies to the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.
Mental consciousness is associated with four faculties, excluding suffering, and is not associated with three faculties, excluding joy and sorrow.
The same applies to the six groups of contact, the six groups of ideation, and the six groups of volition.
The feelings produced by eye contact are not associated with any of the five faculties of feeling, all of which are not associated.
The same applies to the other groups of feelings.
The craving produced by eye contact is associated with two faculties, namely pleasure and indifference, and is not associated with five faculties.
The same applies to the craving produced by ear, nose, tongue, and body contact.
The craving produced by mind contact is associated with three faculties, excluding suffering and sorrow, and is not associated with five faculties.

Chapter 2: Distinctions, Section 2, Chapter 2, Second Gate The six groups of consciousness are the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness.
Are the earth element and feeling associated with the six consciousnesses, or are they not associated with any?
Up to the craving produced by mind contact and the six consciousnesses, how many are associated and how many are not associated?
The earth element and feeling are associated with all six consciousnesses, and there are none that are not associated.
As with the earth element and feeling, the other earth elements are also like this.
Lack of faith is associated with the six consciousnesses and is not associated with the six consciousnesses.
As with lack of faith, the other great defilement grounds are also like this.
Anger is associated with one consciousness, namely the mind consciousness, and is not associated with the six consciousnesses.
As with anger, the other minor defilement grounds are also like this.
Desire and greed are associated with the six consciousnesses and are not associated with the six consciousnesses.

As with desire and greed, hatred is also like this.ğŸ”½Greed for form is associated with four consciousnesses, excluding the nose and tongue consciousnesses, and is not associated with the six consciousnesses.
Greed for the formless, doubt, are associated with one consciousness, namely the mind consciousness, and are not associated with the six consciousnesses.

The five views are associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness, and are not associated with the other six consciousnesses.ğŸ”½Contact through resistance is associated with five consciousnesses, excluding the mental consciousness, and is not associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness.
Contact through suggestion is associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness, and is not associated with five consciousnesses, excluding the mental consciousness.
Contact through illumination is associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness, and is not associated with the other six consciousnesses.
Contact through ignorance and contact through neither illumination nor obscurity are associated with the six consciousnesses and are not associated with the six consciousnesses.
The faculties of pleasure and equanimity are associated with the six consciousnesses and are not associated with the six consciousnesses.
The faculty of pain is associated with five consciousnesses, excluding the mental consciousness, and is not associated with the sixth consciousness.
The faculties of joy and grief are associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness, and are not associated with the other six consciousnesses.
Reflection and investigation are associated with the six consciousnesses and are not associated with one consciousness, namely the mental consciousness.
The dharmas of consciousness are not associated with the six consciousnesses. They are all not associated.
Shamelessness and lack of conscience are associated with the six consciousnesses and not associated with the six consciousnesses.
Eye consciousness is not associated with the six consciousnesses, and all are not associated.
As with eye consciousness, so it is with ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking consciousness.
Eye contact is associated with one consciousness, namely eye, and is not associated with the five consciousnesses except eye.
As with eye contact, so it is with ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact, according to what is appropriate.
As with the six bases of contact, so it is with the six bases of feeling, the six bases of perception, and the six bases of volition.
Eye contact-born craving is associated with one consciousness, namely eye, and is not associated with the six consciousnesses.
As with eye contact-born craving, so it is with ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact-born craving, according to what is appropriate.
Chapter 3, Section 3: Distinguishing the Two Dharmas, Shamelessness and Lack of Conscience.
Among the great earth dharmas, how many are associated with feeling and how many are not associated with these two dharmas?
Up to the love born from mind-contact and these two dharmas, how many are associated and how many are not associated?
The feeling of the great earth dharmas and the unwholesome ones are associated with two dharmas and are not unassociated;
the other feelings are not associated and are all unassociated.
Just as the feeling of the great earth dharmas, the other great earth dharmas are also like this.
The disbelief of the unwholesome ones is associated with two dharmas and is not unassociated;
the other disbelief is not associated and is all unassociated.
Just as with disbelief, the other great afflictions are also like this.
Anger, resentment, concealment, vexation, jealousy, stinginess, and harm are all associated with two dharmas and are not unassociated;
the deceit, flattery, and arrogance of the unwholesome ones are associated with two dharmas and are not unassociated;
the other deceit, flattery, and arrogance are not associated and are all unassociated.
Desire for sensual pleasure and ill-will are both associated with two dharmas and not unassociated.
Desire for form and desire for formlessness are not associated and are definitely unassociated.
Doubt, when unwholesome, is associated with two dharmas and not unassociated.
Other doubts are not associated and are definitely unassociated.
Among the five views, two views are not associated and are definitely unassociated.
The three views, when unwholesome, are all associated with two dharmas and not unassociated.
The remaining three views are not associated and are all unassociated.
Contact associated with resistance, contact with verbal expression, and ignorance contact, when unwholesome, are all associated with two dharmas and not unassociated.
The remaining three contacts are not associated and are all unassociated.
Clear contact and neither clear nor unclear contact are not associated and are definitely unassociated.
The faculty of pleasure, when unwholesome, is associated with two dharmas, and there is none that is not associated.
The remaining faculty of pleasure is not associated, and is definitely not associated.
The faculties of pain, joy, grief, and equanimity are also like this.
The dharmas of investigation, analysis, and consciousness, when unwholesome, are all associated with two dharmas, and there is none that is not associated.

The remaining dharmas of investigation, analysis, and consciousness are not associated, and are all not associated.ğŸ”½Shamelessness and lack of conscience are definitely associated, and there is none that is not associated.ğŸ”½They are definitely not associated with shamelessness, and there is none that is associated.
Lack of conscience is definitely associated with shamelessness, and there is none that is not associated.
It is definitely not associated with lack of conscience, and there is none that is associated.
Eye consciousness, when unwholesome, is associated with two dharmas, and there is none that is not associated.
The remaining eye consciousness is not associated, and is all not associated.
The same applies to the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses, and to the mind consciousness.
The same applies to the six groups of contact, the six groups of feeling, the six groups of perception, and the six groups of volition.
The unwholesome craving produced by contact associated with the eye, ear, and body is all associated with two factors, and none is not associated.
The other craving produced by contact associated with the eye, ear, body, and mind is not associated with any.
The craving produced by contact associated with the nose and tongue is all associated with two factors, and none is not associated.
